Reviews.Title: The best TV for under $300
Reviews.Author: Goldfish "Goldfish"
Reviews.Content: When this TV is on sale it can be bought for under $300. When calibrated properly (televisioninfo.com) it produces a picture that is an incredible viewing experience. I bought this TV for my Girlfriend, however I do own one for myself. I'm extremely pleased with it and there is no way I would look at any other TV for this price range. It includes plenty of options for connectivity, a great warranty, and a beautiful picture!

Reviews.Title: Very good picture, sound and operation
Reviews.Author: M. Erb
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moT8JP4DJFRBX3', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moT8JP4DJFRBX3loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moT8JP4DJFRBX3currentClick) { return cv_moT8JP4DJFRBX3currentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:54 MinsUPDATE: 8/23/2012 - I've been happy with the E321VL that I purchased in May 2012, so much so that I just purchased another at Walmart for 248. However the one I purchased in May gets infrequent use and I'm now starting to have concerns after reading literally hundreds of reports of people having problems with the Vizio brand and in particular this model. I can only rate this based on my experience, which so far has been good. But there is no denying that this model has a very high problem rate. Just Google it and you'll see what I mean. So if you do buy this, proceed with caution and it might be prudent to get an extended service plan as backup insurance. I will update my review if any problem develops with either of the two E321VL HDTV's that I've bought. Again, so far so good, i'm very happy with them and at 248, it's a deal that's hard to pass up. I just hope the TV continues to function without the problems that many people are reporting.----------I was in the market for an under $300, 720p HDTV and the only other requirements were that it have a couple HDMI inputs as well as an audio out in case I ever wanted to add a better speaker. My search began and my first TV purchased was a refurbished Philips HDTV, Philips 32PFL3506/F7 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black. My brief experience with the Philips was not very good so I returned it and purchased this Vizio E321VL.For the $60 difference in price between the refurbished Philips and this brand new Vizio, the Vizio was heads and shoulders above the Philips in every aspect of performance, operation and aesthetics.Once you open the box you only have a few things to do before connecting the HDTV to your cable or antenna. You need to attach the base to the stand neck with a thumbscrew. You then attach the HDTV to the base with 4-screws. Vizio even includes a decent quality philips head screwdriver for this task. The base does not swivel or tilt. You need to insert the provided batteries into the remote unit and you attach the AC power cable to the back of the HDTV. The last thing you need to do is to hook up your antenna/cable connection and you're ready to turn the HDTV on and begin the setup process.The setup takes just a few minutes and you are walked through the steps. Essentially you simply need to select your timezone, whether you want daylight savings time on or off and finally you are walked through the channel scan.The HDTV has a good variety of inputs and outputs, particularly for the price point. You have 2-HDMI inputs, a composite video input, PC input if you wish to use the HDTV as a PC Monitor, stereo RCA input for hooking up an external audio device, stereo RCA audio out, optical/SPDIF audio out, and a USB port to enable USB stick photo slideshows. That's a pretty decent set of inputs and outputs.Compared to the Philips HDTV that I returned, the sound from the Vizio's built-in speakers was surprisingly good. Much better than the Panasonic TC-L32X1 32" HDTV that I currently own, and better than the Samsung LN22A450C1D that I have in my bedroom. All of those TV's I mention have bottom/rear firing speakers that just don't get the sound out to the viewer very well. The Vizio has front facing speakers that not only sound good but project the sound so much better. It's almost like having a soundbar under the HDTV. The sound does lack bass but that's pretty much the way it goes with these built-in speakers. But still, the sound is quite good and I'm pretty picky about sound. You can easily hook up an external speaker if you wish using either the stereo RCA audio out or the optical/SPDIF output.The brightness of the screen is fine and the viewing angle is quite good. Some TV's really suffer in this area. As soon as you move off axis just a little bit the screen brightness and sharpness just drops off dramatically... not so with the Vizio.The remote control is not too bad although the buttons are a bit on the small size.It is quite amazing to me how much quality you can not get in a 32" HDTV for under $300. I am very pleased with my purchase and will update my review if necessary to reflect any issues or problems that may develop.

Reviews.Title: A First Rate Value
Reviews.Author: Sammy Clemens
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these at a popular deal-a-day site. Including five bucks to ship, it was under a deuce. Yes, under a deuce.It's worth MUCH more than that - a very pleasant surprise. For most people's purposes, the resolution, refresh rate, etc. are more than adequate. At proper viewing distances, you will not discern a difference between this and a much more expensive TV.Set up is easy; the tuner is really, really good, and pulls broadcast channels like a champ. A bit of googling will uncover lots of proposed settings to tweak the picture. The set has some fairly useful ones built in ("golf," "movie," "standard," "football," etc.) but tweaking can make a difference.The sound was even a pleasant surprise. Not great, of course - this is not a 'home-theatre-in-a-box', after all. But the front-firing speakers are much better than I'd have expected and beats any of the smaller LCD TV's I've heard.We've enjoyed sports, streamed movies via a laptop, DVDs played via laptop and via DVD player ... all excellent. You can even use it as a monitor for your laptop, though I think it's going to take some serious tweaking to make that worth doing - text is not good ... some sort of resolution issue.Never thought a low-end 32" LCD could be as rewarding as this has already been.UPDATE - Nov.2: The set's still great, but we've added a heavily discounted Pyle amplifier (thanks, Amazon!) and a pair of Pioneer BS41 speakers purchased through a "deal-a-day" site. Once you find the proper settings in the audio menu on the Vizio, this set-up absolutely rocks. It's still only stereo, not surround, but it sounds really good. All in, we're talking about $400, and we couldn't be happier. For any relatively small space, this setup is ideal. It's got us seriously looking at Vizio products for our larger viewing area as well.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: rahul
Reviews.Content: This was my first LCD TV. Being a student, I was looking for cheaper LCD TV's of decent quality and I got what I paid for. This is good for all of my Gaming, Movie watching in living room. Sound isn't great but decent enough.

Reviews.Title: Current model has manufacturer problems
Reviews.Author: Laurel Moffat
Reviews.Content: Purchased this tv online (not Amazon) on 1/1, had it home and set up on 1/7. It completely died on 2/21 and a quick internet search of the problem (will not power off, will not respond to remote or on-set power button) reveals dozens of similar problems with the tv in purchases made since November.Within 5 minutes on the phone with Vizio they offered to replace it, but I decided it wasn't worth the hassle and luckily the retailer gave me a full refund. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: TV has small problems, Vizio Customer Service is the BIG problem
Reviews.Author: E.S.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in Sept. 2011. From the beginning it would not always have a picture (only black screen) but only sound when the DVD starts; this happens about 3 out of 5 times. I called Vizio about this and at first was told to check whether there was any back light next time it happened. When I remembered to call back I was told if it happened again (more like when...) I should call again and I repair order would be issued. Vizio has a policy that while the purchase is still under warranty a replacement will be given only if repair fails. It did happen again, I called and the repair was ordered. Tech didn't show at appointed time. I wasn't willing to waste more time making yet more phone calls and requested a replacement. After 2 hrs on the phone talking to several different Vizio customer service reps I regret that I ever bought this TV since it seems that Vizio punishes the customer for Vizio's faulty products.I cannot recommend buying this product as -judging from reviews - lemons aren't uncommon and as a customer you can't expect any reasonable treatment from this company!

Reviews.Title: Fast shipping, great product
Reviews.Author: S. Barlow
Reviews.Content: I received the product within the estimated time and it arrived in it's original packaging. the product exceeded my expectations, so I'm more than pleased. :) also I had contacted the company before ordering and I received a response within 24hrs. So to sum it up: great service, great product, and it arrived in excellent condition, so I will be ordering from these guys again.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this TV - Updated 10/15/2012
Reviews.Author: D. Wortham
Reviews.Content: Excellent Out Of Box Experience (OOBE).The stand was very easy to install and the box included a cheapy phillips screwdriver! Thank you Vizio for recognizing and addressing a very annoying issue. Little things like that make for a very happy customer.Batteries for the remote, two AA, were included also.The TV will need to be laid face down on a clear clean spot. Take a minute to make sure there is nothing, like the included screwdriver, in the way that might scratch your new screen. Last year, I scratched my new computer monitor like that on a power supply that was covered by a thin blanket on the bed.Setup was easy as pie. Just plug in the coaxial cable and set the channel input. We don't have an HDMI cable yet.Picture quality is excellent.On screen menus are intuitive for the most part. Lots of adjustments can be made - you can tweak broad parameters or nitty gritty.Here is a tip for you if you have DishTV. The picture was too big for the screen. I looked at a lot of settings but couldn't find the one that was causing this problem. Finally, with a lot of Googling, it turned out to be the *Format button on the Dish remote. Set the HD to 'Normal' and SD to 'Normal'. The TV remote is set to 'Wide'. That gives me a letter box picture that fills the screen correctly. We don't have an HDMI cable yet but I will update this review once we get one and switch over.Another bit of information that I gleaned - traditional coaxial cables are only capable of 480i resolution. You need at least RGB for higher resolution and HDMI is, of course, optimum. HDMI cables have version numbers. Unless you research it for your specific TV you'll want the highest version number you can afford. So watch out for clearance bin cables. It does make a difference. There are two broad categories of HDMI cables. High Speed and Standard. Standard HDMI data are rated at 76 MHz which is 1080i. High Speed HDMI are rated at 340 MHz which is full 1080p. Standard HDMI cables are fine for TV classes below 32 inch. Those TVs do not benefit from the higher bandwidth of the more expensive High Speed version.There are some conclusions to draw from the HDMI information I found. You can buy the less expensive Standard cable and rest easy in your purchase. Or you can buy the more expensive High Speed and future proof your purchase. The evolution of cable standards, reflected in cable version numbers, means that getting the High Speed now may be self-defeating since better cable specifications in a year or two will kill any advantage to buying the more expensive one now if you get no immediate benefit from it. The current highest version number is 1.3 as of July 7th 2012. Version 1.4 is on the horizon.This is a 6 foot one:BlueRigger High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet 6.6 Feet (2m) - Supports 3D and Audio Return [Latest Version]... in particular, even if you go with the shorter version, read the review by A. Dent about this cable. From what I've read, TVs 32 inch and up will benefit from the High Speed version....and this is a 3 foot one:BlueRigger High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet (3 Feet) - Supports 3D and Audio Return [Latest Version]Back to the TV itself:Really an excellent value for the dollar. If you aren't familiar with the Vizio brand, they are the largest LCD manufacturer in the world. They make LCD screens for other TV companies and computer companies.[UPDATE October 15th 2012]Wow! What a difference a cable can make! I recently got - AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable (6.5 Feet/2.0 Meters) - Supports Ethernet, 3D, and Audio Return [Newest Standard] - to use with the satellite box and this TV. The difference in picture quality is truly amazing. So, this 720p 32" HDTV does benefit from an upgrade of the coaxial to HDMI. I have the HDMI version 1.4 which is the latest standard but I think any HDMI version with 720p or greater capability will give you the best picture you can have on the TV. Shop around. That one I linked is an Amazon Basics item and it is a great value.[/UPDATE]

Reviews.Title: Great but the Sound could be Better
Reviews.Author: Cindy Windham, ME
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is terrific my only complaint is that the sound could be better. The set-up was easy there were a few items I could not figure out BUT I called Vizio and they were fantastic. They talked me through and it is all wonderful now.

Reviews.Title: Lemon
Reviews.Author: A. C. Smith
Reviews.Content: TV was fine while it lasted.  Unfortunately that was only a week over it's 1 year warranty.  Died w/ what is apparently a very common issue w/ this model.  TV will turn on and Vizio shows on the screen, but it will not respond to any commands, remote or on TV.  Will go back to a better quality brand..

Reviews.Title: so far so good.
Reviews.Author: cuzzin brucie "cuzzin brucie"
Reviews.Content: this is a great buy if you are looking for a video screen to place in a guest bedroom, kids room or the like.  Was easily able to sync it up to my directv remote.

Reviews.Title: Complete Lemon
Reviews.Author: E. Stewart
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in November- November 27, 2011 to be exact and on March 7, 2012, it completely stopped working. It would turn on, the Vizio logo would light up, the Vizio name would appear on screen, and that's all it would do. I spent two hours on the phone with Vizio Customer Service, who assured me numerous times that they were, "dotting all their i's and crossing all their t's," to help me fix the problem. The customer service rep asked me if it was plugged in. Yes. Were there batteries in the remote? Yes. Could I unplug the tv and hold the power button for 30 seconds? Yes. And? Well, after that little experiment my tv stopped working altogether.To make a long story short, Vizio told me that they would have a technician coming to my house to fix it and I could expect their call in two to three days. This is day five, and still no call from a technician. I called Vizio again today to make sure I understood right, that they would call me and I wasn't supposed to call them. Vizio confirmed that a technician would be calling me. I told them it has been five days. A very optimistic customer service rep told me, "They might just call you today yet." Well, they didn't. And now it's the weekend, so I doubt I'll be getting any calls.The same customer service rep then asked me if I would like to purchase an extended warranty on my tv. I asked what it consisted of. "It will run you about 70 dollars." She said. I informed her kindly that I've wasted enough money with Vizio and would not be interested in repeating this process again in the future.Needless to say, this is my last Vizio tv. It was great for the three months it worked. Even after it's 'fixed,' if the technician ever decides to call, I doubt I'll ever fully trust turning it on or off.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC entry-level HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Waylon Piercy "Vaya con monstros!"
Reviews.Content: When I raised the money to finally upgrade to an HDTV, I did quite a bit of research to decide which TV was the right one for me. A 32" set was the largest I could acommodate, and all of my research indicated that the Vizio E321VL was among the very best in its class. This TV meets all of my expectations, and then some. Setup is a breeze, and the picture is amazing. It lacks some of the features present on higher-priced models, such as internet connectivity, but things like that are a non-issue for me(I can easily stream movies and TV shows via my Xbox 360 instead). The sound is  better than I expected based on some reviews, but I keep the set muted and use my 5.1 setup anyway, instead of the TV's speakers. The built-in digital tuner detected a good many channels that the decoder box Comcast sent me last year for my old TV did not, although some are duplicates. There are several picture mode pre-sets, and plenty of options for creating custom modes. Combining ease of use and outstanding performance, this TV really feels like a bargain at less than $300.

Reviews.Title: nice tv for the price
Reviews.Author: hedyka
Reviews.Content: It's  a nice tv for the price. I like it , the sound is great and the size is perfect for a bedroom.Again another purchase from Amazon.com !!! low price ,excellent product and super fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 32"
Reviews.Author: Art Campbell "Art C"
Reviews.Content: I did research on 32" TV's and found Vizio to be the Best IMO.  We purchased one from Sam's Club for $250.00.We are completely satisfied in the TV in all respects.  Very user friendly setup and operation.  Excellent remote control.  This is our first Vizio but definitely not our last.I highly recommend the product and Brand.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 32 IN. LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Michele Dorothea Hock "zumamichey"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT!!!!!  it's easy to set up.  it has a clear, sharp picture.  totally perfect for the money! if you're not knowledgeable  about buying electronics, i suggest this product is perfect for the "non techno geek" buyer!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Tim F
Reviews.Content: I have a 37in LG that has an awesome picture but I wasn't really happy with the sound which, to me, sounds very muddy and compressed. I decided to try the Vizio because many reviews said the sound is really good. I bought this tv last week (March 2012) and like many others, found it extremely simple and intuitive to set it up. The even include a screwdriver to install the tv stand on the back. It's fairly light and mounted on the wall easily. The picture is excellent.  After a week of use to my ear anyway it sounds a bit "tinny". There's very little bass and minimal midrange. Voices sound clear and distinct... music, not so much. Concert videos are great to watch, but disappointing to hear.  If I had it to do over, at the exact same price point, I'd probably have gone with the LG, but we'll see how this one holds up.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Charles Jewell
Reviews.Content: fast shipping and the tv works great for a semi small roomcolor is good and all functions work adequately

Reviews.Title: Big believer in Vizio.
Reviews.Author: Ghenghis
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on sale one year ago, and after 12 months of daily useit still works like it just came out of the box.With an HD feed, the picture is stunning. Colors are true and the contrastis crisp. Many other presets like Movies, Sports, Football, Golf, etc. Samewith audio presets for Rock, Jazz, Classical, etc. 2 HDMI inputs is all you'llever need for a secondary TV, also has a USB port for photo viewing, and aVGA input so you can surf the web just by changing to another channel.The remote is intuitive and feels good in your hand. Its not overdone, andhas all the right controls for instant access to settings. And the refreshrate is instantaneous. I'm on ATT Uverse and there is zero lag when changingchannels.Very happy with this TV, now looking at the 70" Razor model from Vizio.

Reviews.Title: As It Should
Reviews.Author: Ize
Reviews.Content: Hu im 14 and i just love this amazing perect picture tv! I use it for Tv, Gaming, and as my PC monitor! It does the job not good but excellent!

Reviews.Title: OK Deal
Reviews.Author: Richard R. Stevens
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this TV initially.  In retrospect though I believe that I would have been happier with a 1080 unit.The TV works fine and I have it in my dining room where I can watch while I eat.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for a great price
Reviews.Author: Klind
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this purchase. The picture quality is very good. I have had my Vizio 32" for years now and the only issue that I have had is that speakers have gotten a bit distorted (started happening 4 years after purchase). I have since added a surround system to the television so overall I am satisfied with the purchase. I would recommend this brand of television to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great value, excellent picture!
Reviews.Author: O. Guzman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as an 'emergency' as my Samsung LN32A330J1D that I bought Christmas 2008 has image problems (image looks like a film negative currently).  I was upset to hear that Samsung had issues with their capacitors and although they are fixing that, my screen still looks the same.  I went to Wal-Mart and found this TV for only $228! (Samsung was $399 in 2008) so prices have nearly been slashed 50% since then.  Sadly the cost to repair this Samsung is just under the cost of a new TV, not worth it!I brought it home and was very easy to set up, I already had an existing TV stand that mounts the TV to a frame that rises above the stand itself, so it was a swap in and out process.The features aren't impressive, "only" 720p, has only 2 HDMI ports, 60 Hz, but this is going in my bedroom where it's only used for the occasional movie in bed or waking up to watch the news.  I wasn't disappointed at all since I have a home theatre setup in the living room with a big screen and surround.Regardless, the image quality on these newer Vizios are finally on par with the bigger name brands (LG, Sony, Samsung, etc) and no longer suffer from a fuzzy image or bad contrast.  For $228 you really can't ask for more, I was actually impressed with the built-in speakers compared to my older Samsung.This makes for a great "replacement" TV or maybe if you are finally getting an HDTV for the first time.It measures 31.5" diagonally just like other so-called 32" TVs and you aren't paying for the marketing.There was a Westinghouse 32" for $199.99 at Best Buy, but I didn't quite like the contrast/colour compared to this one.Overall, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Black screen of death
Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: As a student, the price of this television really appealed to me. :) I purchased one about six months ago, and it served me well. However, a few days ago I got the dreaded black screen of death (a common issue with Vizio televisions, from what I understand) Stuck on the Vizio logo when I turned it on, and then it just stopped turning on altogether. So, while it served me well the first six months, I'd say look for something a bit nicer if you want some sort of longevity from your machine. After all, you get what you pay for. :)

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: cathy mcabee
Reviews.Content: I love it! It's exactly as it said. Beautiful picture. Best purchase by far! Had no problems with it at all.

Reviews.Title: Great for a bedroom
Reviews.Author: Friggenfatty
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Wal-mart a couple of months ago and i just absolutely love the TV. It is wall mounted and is hooked up to my satellite and a Xbox 360 and a blu-ray player. The quality of the picture is great for a small bedroom, the sound i really dont hear because i have a HTIB. I really love using it as my computer monitor. overall i feel the TV is a great buy and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E321VL
Reviews.Author: Capital Hill
Reviews.Content: Quality of picture is pretty good not the best but expected for the price.  I would recommend this product if you're not looking to spend to much money.

Reviews.Title: Bubaloo
Reviews.Author: Les Martin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my daughter In Nov. 2012 as a Xmas present. It was sold as NEW. The TV died in just over 3 months. I contacted the seller (STL PRO Inc.), and was told their warranty was only for 30 days, but Vizio would cover it for a year. Vizio stated that the serial # showed the TV wasn't originally sold to STL PRO and couldn't verify if it was new or reboxed, thus voiding the warranty. STL PRO refused to refund my money. Thank god Amazon stepped up to the plate and gave me my money back. Lets put STL PRO out of busines

Reviews.Title: never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: neda
Reviews.Content: This TV only worked for less than 2 weeks. I have no picture just a black screen. I contacted Vizio and they wont help me since I purchased it from Galactics which is not an authorized dealer.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Unsatisfied
Reviews.Content: Just awful, the tv worked for a few hours then shut off and wont turn back on, I'd give this less than one star if it were possible. The condition was also listed as "very good," so it was very misleading, wouldn't purchase from them again.

Reviews.Title: vizio lcd
Reviews.Author: james r ferro
Reviews.Content: Great bang for the buck.Packaged well easy to assemble.Mounted on wall of sitting room looks great .Good picture and sound .Would recommrend this item to a friend.VERY SATISFIED

Reviews.Title: outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Gilbert Williams
Reviews.Content: This was my third TV in 3 months.  I returned the other 2 because the sound wasso bad I couldn't hear it across a 12 foot wide kitchen. I won't mention the names,but this VIZIO was just what I  wanted.  Beautiful picture, wonderful sound andeasy setup.  I would recommend this 32 inch TV to any one

Reviews.Title: thank you thank you amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Gumby "Gumby"
Reviews.Content: just want to say thank you for allowing me to purchase this great flat screen tv for 290.50 what a bargain for a great tv.thanks  again amazon. the pix crisp clear and beautiful no blinking.i forgot to mention that i ordered this on 11/2 recieved on 11/7 ordered withstandard free shipping and handling way to go amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality - Good Price!
Reviews.Author: Diamond M. Dominguez "diamon2x"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 32 inch TV for my bedroom yesterday.  I am just as impressed by this Vizio as I was 4 years ago when I had bought my first Vizio TV 4 years ago for the living room.  Just like the Vizio in my living room, the set up instructions on this TV are very easy to follow.  The TV is up an running in less than 30 minutes. The Remote: Just like the Vizio in my living roon, the buttons on this new remote are very neatly thought out in the way they are placed on the remote. You can locate buttons in the dark.  Speakers: I love the sound bar across the front bottom which puts out a very nice stereo sound.  Unless you're a meticulous person who needs a big movie theater sound, you don't need to go out an buy a sound bar.  The stereo sound output is so good until you don't have to raise the volume level to maximum to hear the sound.  Screen quality: The HD screen picture is as clear as a bell.  After initial set up, the was no need to adjust the color because it was already calibrated just right.  I've had the 40 inch Vizio HD TV in my living room for 4 1/2 years now, and have never had a single problem with it.  And that's why I went and bought this Vizio 32 inch for my bedroom. In my opinion, Vizio's quality is as good as the higher end brand names, but with a cheaper price.  Buy it.'

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: AW
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv and it worked fine for about a half hour. It then shut off and wouldn't turn back on. I was extremely disappointed. I called customer service they sent someone out about a week later and he fixed it in a half hour. Works great now overall good buy.

Reviews.Title: GREAT GREAT GREAT GREAT TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: ininme
Reviews.Content: I got this set for Christmas and it only took about 7 minutes to set up. Picture quality is absolutely FANTASTIC!! PS2 as most of you know has no hd, with this TV you don't need it!!! It has a wide range of audio and video settings, and a great usb port to look at pics on it!!! DONT refuse this offer. BEST TV IN THE WORLD!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: John Lopez
Reviews.Content: The photo is not accurate.  This TV has a piano-black finish with a nice bevelled edge.  The entire bottom contains the speakers, which far out perform my other, "sleeker" Visio.  This TV's sound is reminiscent of the older tube TVs as far as volume goes, but it also has Dolby sound.The cusomizable sound and picture are simple and fairly extensive.  I'm extremely happy with my purchase.It came in original packaging with all accessories and manuals...referbished?  I would never have known.

Reviews.Title: Perfect dresser top TV. i recommend it!
Reviews.Author: Dregischan "Dregischan - CIO"
Reviews.Content: It came fast and in perfect condition. At 32", it works great as my dresser top TV. I really like it. The remote is nice and solid. I use my MINIX X7 with it and can rest peacefully watching Amazon Prime after a very long day.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BE AFRAID… BE VERY AFRAID!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Hernandez
Reviews.Content: This TV set turns out to be the best version of a disposable TV if there ever was one. It will run for about 1 year then begin to roll over and die. Eventually, the darn thing will not power on at all. Search the model and you'll find if is a very common problem with this brand.Once it fails to power on, you'll find out it's out of warranty and too expensive to fix so… you'll just throw it away (hence the disposable category).The brand and their products are garbage.

Reviews.Title: Over 2 years with no problems at all
Reviews.Author: Paul Rooney
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry that others have had issues with theirs, but this TV has everything I was looking for, like reliability and ease of setup.

Reviews.Title: Good Choise
Reviews.Author: Jorge
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this Vizio 32in LCD HDTV, It is the perfect choise to for a bedroom, with a very clear screen and good sound.

Reviews.Title: 2 TV
Reviews.Author: Marcecy
Reviews.Content: We are pleased with both the came super faster, we are happy. The image, the size, the color, everything is great. I am sure we made a great purchase

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Susan J. Stanovich
Reviews.Content: This TV was easy to set up, has excellent picture and sound quality. Definitely worth the price. I love it!

Reviews.Title: It works as expected
Reviews.Author: Sandeep Jain
Reviews.Content: It is value for money. Picture quality is great. It works well with Apple Tv and connecting with laptop through HDMI and vga cable respectively.

Reviews.Title: Great picture again
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: This company produces a good quality in the picture, easy on the eyes.  After researching several products, I chose this company because the quality seems to always be there.

Reviews.Title: great picture quality, arrived on time
Reviews.Author: syllewun
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about TVs, but the 32" Vizio definately met my expectations. The picture quality is awesome, and we were pleasantly surprised with the auto-off feature. We often fall asleep watching a movie, and this TV automatically shuts off after a certain amount of time after the movie is over. Sound quality isn't bad either. I haven't cranked it up yet, but so far, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Luke Wallace
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised no scratches or damages to the television. Picture is a clean and clear. Great Product and purchase

Reviews.Title: good t.v.
Reviews.Author: Chirrel
Reviews.Content: this TV is good for the price. it has different screen and sound adjustments.. It has an hdmi port. which works awesome with our computer. I 've had it since march 2012 and its now november. we have a few vizio flat screen tv's. they all work well. the only thing with this tv is the the snow at the very top line of the screen on some channels that doesnt go away with screen sizing. we even called vizio to figure it out and it didnt work. but we are so used to the tv and it doesnt happen often that we dont mind. and as far as the company that sent it they didnt send it with the stand. we HAD to mount it on the wall, which is what we wanted anyway.

Reviews.Title: great tv!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: mr.j
Reviews.Content: got it USED!!! its a great tv!!! one of the best tvs i have ever used!! i use this for gameing and movie veiwing, i love it!

Reviews.Title: GREAT price for a GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: Gabby
Reviews.Content: great deal for a 32 inch tv for my dorm. the picture quality is great and the delivery was fast. only downside is i can't watch movies through my usb but i can still use my hdmi ports which is great.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Megsatron
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV for a good price. It works great and I love the HD channels. I recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: I am increasing my stars.From the t.v I bought.
Reviews.Author: Mistermikey6555
Reviews.Content: I contacted them after I got a bad television for close to 200.00 They seem to be willing to work with me.Providing I do get a full refund I will be changing this review and increasing the stars for the fact they seem to be trying to help out."It started after I bought the t.v it came in a timely manner however once I hooked it up and try to power it on picture would not come up.Made things worse when I contacted vizio and gave them the serial number for them to tell me they bought it at a walmart and tried to return it..."That was my second clue"After getting off the phone with them I proceeded to call BlinQ who explained to me every now and then a bad product slips through and that must of been what happened".I also contacted Amazon then my credit card company to explain to them my situation.BlinQ did seem to be concerned and they told me after they receive the television with in 3-5 days I should have my money back on my card.I will change the review for the fact they kept their word once that is done ill be a happy camper until then I am out nearly 200.00 and playing the waiting game to see what happens next.

Reviews.Title: Customer service
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: We all know samsung vs. Vizio. No brainer there. I got what I paid. The key is the exceptional customer service. The TV had some board issue and the vendor did a great job with addressing the issue.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Hensel
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV since May and I'm very happy with it. One thing they never mentioned on the box or anything is that it's a 1080P television. When I have my PS3 connected, it displays in full 1080P. They only thing lacking is the sound. It's kind of tinny, but the speakers are really nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for a low price
Reviews.Author: James Ray Wilson Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these at Wal-Mart earlier this spring back when I was still employed.  My tax check was in so I got it.  This is my first HDTV and I gotta say I am pleased.  Setting it up was easy. The picture looks great. Still looking to get a blu-ray play in the future so my movies will look better. But the DVDs still look good on it.  It has loads of useful settings. Unlike some people who own this TV I haven't had any problems out of it. With how the TVs are placed in the trucks at Wal-mart this actually surprised me lol. If any of you have ever been an unloader at a Wal-Mart you will know what I mean on this.  Anyways when I bought this I also got Wal-Mart's extended warranty for an extra 20 dollars. This actually gives me an addition 2 year on Vizeo's 1 year warranty only it is through Wal-Mart. If anything happens to my TV in that time period, Wal-Mart will fix or replace it for no charge. This means even if it somehow got knocked off my tv stand and broke on my floor they would fix or replace it.  Not planning on doing that though lol.  Might take advantage of this in a year or so if somehow the screen gets scratched. But I don' see that happening.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: plumbertim
Reviews.Content: Love it! it is every thing I thought it would be! Has a great picture and sounds good also!!Shipping was great to got the TV three days early!

Reviews.Title: Visio 32" tv
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Very nice used tv could ask for anything more. I actually got I for my gf birthday and she loved it!

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Decent picture
Reviews.Author: Robert N
Reviews.Content: great TV for the price as long as you know you're getting a slightly inferior picture compared to other similar televisions...

Reviews.Title: vizio e321vl not a buy
Reviews.Author: B. Cohen
Reviews.Content: Purchased the vizio e321vl in Nov 2011.  The TV started having a problem in May 2013.  Same problem as others had e.g.,would not power on and only a white VIZIO logo when it did power on.  VIZIO tech support gave the plug unplug procedure which was no help.  Long and short they indicated the power board probably a problem and not worth the repair bill.  Final decision was to get a new TV and never buy a VIZIO product.

Reviews.Title: warm up noise
Reviews.Author: Will not buy another Vizio TV!
Reviews.Content: Makes popping noises as it warms up, About 8 to 10 so far over about 5 minutes. Support said that it is normal. I have 2 other brands and they do not make warm up noises. Will not buy another one. Have told all my friends and family that they also should not buy one.

Reviews.Title: A TV should last most than two years ...
Reviews.Author: L. D. Best
Reviews.Content: In April, 2010, my old fashioned TV went kablooey and we went shopping.  I was very happy to find this Vizio model ... 1080p definition is better than my current computer monitor.Got it out of the box and set up, things were great.  I was not up to doing the scanning and weeding for channels, so my son got that job.  Soon I was quite happy watching my basic TV cable on a nice wide screen with great definition.But three months ago the light went out ... the little one in front that says "I have power, so grab the remote and turn me on."  We messed with this and that and tried stuff like unplugging and pushing buttons and then, for no reason we could pin it down to, the light was back and I had my TV again.Then on Sept 25th I once again had no TV.  Tried almost everything I could think of, then bit the bullet and logged on to Vizio website.  Got a 'chat tech' who had me do this and that, told me TV was out of warranty.  Told me TV was definitely broken, and gave me contact info on authorized repair firms.I wasn't about to give up, and finally decided I'd try something smart:  Switch out the power cable and see if that made the TV work.  Wow!  It did!  Happy camper once again.  Until today.  Went through the whole routine, unplugged power cable, etc etc and soforth .... still no TV.This thing is solid state, no tubes to burn out, no resisters to get fat and bloated, no 'gun' to get out of sync.  It should last longer than two years!  It hasn't been moved between locations, certainly hasn't be dropped or beaten upon.  Just because the warranty is only one year should not mean the TV is unreliable after 12 months or even 24.  My old tube thing lasted more than ten years!I'll call the repair place tomorrow.  Hopefully they won't expect more than a new TV would cost.  But if they do, I don't think I'll get a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Yay!
Reviews.Author: mamapat50 "Pat"
Reviews.Content: I checked out this particular model in the stores in  our area. I wanted a larger screen model but had limited vertical space.  This model fit the bill and the price was competitive, plus since I am a PRIME member, no shipping.  It arrived in a timely fashion and safely delivered, can't ask more than that.

Reviews.Title: Works so far
Reviews.Author: Rae
Reviews.Content: I've heard these TV's sometimes don't work or stop working.  So far this one is just fine.  No issues.  Good quality, good sound, great price.

Reviews.Title: Another Winner!
Reviews.Author: E.  Wheaton
Reviews.Content: I bought a Vizio TV two years ago, because our daughter had one,and said it was the best one in her house.  The recent one I bought for our sunroom,and it was the right choice. As usual,Amazon had it delivered promptly,and we were enjoying it just two days later.

Reviews.Title: Vizio flatscreen TV review
Reviews.Author: Cassie
Reviews.Content: The TV came quickly and was not damaged during delivery. The picture is great on it and there's not a thing wrong with the TV itself. Looks brand spankin' new! Very happy with the product! Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: black screen of death after 4months
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: When we first bought this tv 4 months ago we were very pleased, nice picture and no problems.  Turned it on this evening and no picture, just a black screen.  So disappointed.  It is weird I can see the v visio start up, hear the tv and then nothing but black.

Reviews.Title: Warning! Power supply issues!
Reviews.Author: Mark Enfinger
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv exactly 90 days ago, the tv was on 5 days a week about 6 hours a day. As I was watching it there was a slight popping or cracking noise and the tv was dead as a door nail after that. I went out on the forums and read up on the failure rates and this tv has major power supply failure problems. I bet all those ads you see for the refurbished models that you can buy now are failed ones that have been repaired and will only again fail on the suckers that buy them. Do not get this model! Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Vizio 32 Inch Tv
Reviews.Author: 88KeysN4Strings
Reviews.Content: Product came in exactly as stated. Shipper did excellent job making sure that Television arrived on time and in stated condition.

Reviews.Title: It worked for 18 months
Reviews.Author: giskard
Reviews.Content: until we heard a loud sound while watching it, like something exploded inside. I called Vizio and they right away suggested that the power supply board may have failed but since I was out of warranty there was nothing they could do.This is a very common problem in Vizio. Google vizio pop of death.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Dealer
Reviews.Content: Received in perfect condition well packaged. Came with everything you needed in the box even the HDMI cable. Nice picture and good sound easy set up would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Seller sold a broken TV
Reviews.Author: Kimmie
Reviews.Content: This Vizio E321VL is clear, beautiful, and broken. Almost everyday at some point of watching this TV, the volume turns way up and then the TV shuts off. After a few seconds, the TV turns on again. It's eery and embarrassing, if we have company over. This purchase discouraged me from making so many purchases from dealers in other states. You never know what you're getting. Very disappointing that you spend your hard-earned money on items when the seller does not disclose the true nature of the product in the product description.

Reviews.Title: Just o.k.
Reviews.Author: Dorothea Casaubon
Reviews.Content: No physical on/off switch.  Picture is poor, despite many ways to tweak it via menu programs. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Avoid purchasing this TV
Reviews.Author: Ezra Blumenthal
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely terrible product. the picture is awful. It changes its contrast all the time for no reason. I'll be in the middle of a show and the whole screen just gets darker and then later switches back. The sound is also horrific. Often I have to blast the volume up 2x a normal setting just to hear what is being said. The price is attractive, but you will be disappointed with what you get. Spend more money, and buy a more reputable brand and a more quality product. If others are writing rave reviews, be wary that they might be paid by Vizio for it. I cant imagine anyone would actually enjoy a TV that was this bad.

ProductInfo.Features:
100,000 to 1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio
SRS TruVolume and SRS TruSurround HD audio for advanced virtual surround sound
JPEG photo viewer
Ambient Light Sensing technology
Exceeds ENERGY STAR 41 Guidelines
ProductInfo.Name: Vizio E321VL 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV - Black
